channel.title: November 5th - Facebook the next victim?
channel.description:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FceX9zEgE50 Found this quite interesting. For all you out there who don't know who anonomys are:
Anonymous (used as a mass noun) is a group initiating active civil disobedience and spread through the Internet while staying hidden, originating in 2003 on the imageboard 4chan, representing the concept of many online community users simultaneously existing as an anarchic, digitized global brain.[2] It is also generally considered to be a blanket term for members of certain Internet subcultures, a way to refer to the actions of people in an environment where their actual identities are not known.[3] In its early form, the concept has been adopted by a decentralized online community acting anonymously in a coordinated manner, usually toward a loosely self-agreed goal, and primarily focused on entertainment. Beginning with 2008, the Anonymous collective has become increasingly associated with collaborative, international hacktivism, undertaking protests and other actions, often with the goal of promoting internet freedom and freedom of speech. Actions credited to "Anonymous" are undertaken by unidentified individuals who apply the Anonymous label to themselves as attribution.[4] Although not necessarily tied to a single online entity, many websites are strongly associated with Anonymous. This includes notable imageboards such as 4chan, Futaba, their associated wikis, Encyclopædia Dramatica, and a number of forums.[5] After a series of controversial, widely-publicized protests and distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks by Anonymous in 2008, incidents linked to its cadre members have increased.[6] In consideration of its capabilities, Anonymous has been posited by CNN to be one of the three major successors to WikiLeaks.[7]
Opionions guys? I personally think they might get facebook offline temporarily but not permanatley...

item.title: November 5th - Facebook the next victim?
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:69, topic:415567”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=517506.msg3768119#msg3768119 date=1317432655]
Some of the head guys in anon didn’t want to attack FB but Anonymous is an organization. Someone comes up with something, people fall behind it.
[/quote]
You fail, Anon isn’t an organization, it is a system of beliefs of right and wrong, its an idea.[/quote]

Doesn’t that define an organization?

Read full topic

item.title: November 5th - Facebook the next victim?
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

It’d be funny and nothing else if it were for only a couple minutes , hours , days , weeks…
If it were for longer it’d be even funnier xD

The only thing I like about FB is that its free communication ; I cbf to pay for them phone bills…
Aside from that , if FB would go down (permanently) I think I’d just move with everyone I know to Skype.

Basically , nobody SHOULD care about FB going down ; there’s enough other ways to communicate with your friends and people.

Read full topic

item.title: November 5th - Facebook the next victim?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Hot_Potato:

I bet after Facebook gets hacked, another social network will be created just like Facebook :S

You must have missed this quote:

[quote=“noobs are ftw, post:49, topic:415567”][quote author=Hot_Potato link=topic=517506.msg3762410#msg3762410 date=1316974138]
Lol, wonder how many new people will join Myspace after this epidemic.
[/quote]

no1 they will be going to google+[/quote]

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:40, topic:415567”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=517506.msg3759985#msg3759985 date=1316791478]

But theirs a difference. PSN make about maybe 2m a day in Vp players and stuff, Facebook makes about 200m aday with advertisments in, myspace and skype. Facebook is always finding new ways to Block Attackers. PSN cant afford it.

PSN is not a 1b corp Sony is a 1b corp

=/

Facebook makes $2 billion in revenue. Their net worth is significantly greater than that. Mark Zuckerberg himself is worth approximately $17 billion.

Sony is a whole new ballgame. Their revenue exceed $86 billion, and their net worth is probably in the hundreds of billions.

Anyway, what do they expect to actually do? Simple denial of service? There is no definitive way to indefinitely provide a denial of service to Facebook, without government intervention.
[/quote]
Simple denial of service attacks can go very far these days, there people out there with net bots numbering in the tens of thousands controlled through RATS through infected computers. Get 100-200 of these people together and it would be impossible for the site to weed out the DDOSers as their is no real connection through the first computer used, and hundreds of innocent people would be fined/jailed for something they did not do. The only option facebook would have is to shut down or give into what even demands were made public before the attack.[/quote]

As this is true, can you really fathom the kind of bandwidth a memcached system like Facebook can sustain? They have over 750,000,000 users. Their traffic everyday is beginning to approach and even exceed Google’s. Not even the conficker botnet would have stood a chance against a site that isn’t dependent on specific servers, at least that’s my opinion.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:8, topic:415567”][quote author=Coelho link=topic=517506.msg3759206#msg3759206 date=1316736787]
There is a valid point in this everyone is obviously not seeing. It isn’t anonymous trying to say that they are superior, but trying to protect people’s privacy.
[/quote]Yea that is true. I don’t support them also but I do see they might have a valid point. Google uses a huge supercomputer to sort through everything some searches and if anything does not have copyright on it, they steal it apparently… What i heard.[/quote]
So you’re saying that google does not own the copyrights on their supercomputer?

[quote=“Coelho, post:15, topic:415567”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=517506.msg3759247#msg3759247 date=1316739285]

Apparently Facebook is selling information to the FBI. Sounds believable, but who knows? Only the FBI and Facebook. Where the hell does Anonymous make up/find this shit?

I hope Facebook goes down. Then the world will know about Anonymous! Are those fuckers the ones who attacked the PSN?
[/quote]They were accused but I think they were proven innocent.

No no, they were the people who hacked PSN.[/quote]
???

Read full topic
